iFj3I_aZNzixtukm5vTjfQ.text: Excited to see what this place is like during the summer! I've visited a couple times for drinks & dinner & nothing has disappointed. The service is always prompt, no matter where you sit & the food is great for dine in or take out. I love that they have some food specials throughout the week. Definitely a go-to!

ay-aF_-nleHS4PTFmyJmNQ.text: Mac n cheese pulled pork grilled sandwich!! Tacos and nachos all excellent. Server on top of her game. Lots of big TVs.

HuAQ4Wv_WxYZpXZn9WYPvA.text: Great experience.  Went for restaurant week and had a blast with some friends.  Owner stopped by our table and made sure our experience was great.  Would come back for sure.

SKaXNH9uhXvSMzxfj-fFzA.text: This was my second time eating at the establishment. I got tacos the first time and had to come back for more. Found myself disappointed in the amount of food on the tacos this time around. Don't get me wrong, they're delicious but I would like a little more bang for my buck. I ordered the Mac and cheese for my side and it lacked flavor and was oily enough for me to pour it out before I consumed it. Service was awesome. Our server Alyssa handled herself very well for it being the last night of restaurant week. The vibe of the whole place is really nice. I love all of the charm. I'll be back, probably regularly, but won't be getting the Mac and cheese again.

nWMMXeL05qT0u5dYxTVkSw.text: I gave this place a 5 star rating because of the food.  It was awesome!!! However if you are looking for a quaint little restaurant for your significant other this is not it. This is more of a restaraunt/bar where you are surrounded by TV's. That begin said the food is worth it.

KAOzmzd5tx-lbleDUv_qPA.text: Food was mediocre. Service was very slow and it was not busy when I went. Disappointed.

BaeNFmS0GE4OX_BBl94bxw.text: Oh how I've missed this patio! Our group of ten came here last night and had a great time! Our server Amanda was awesome. She was super friendly and on top of everything we needed. Beers and drinks were pretty cheap and our friends said the food was good. They've definitely upgraded the place and the high top tables and patio bar are a great addition. They have big tv's over the interior bar and tv's surrounding the patio. This is definitely a great spot to catch a game or grab drinks with the crew. It was a little slow for a Friday night, so get the word out and let's support this new neighborhood gem!

E2k7Ecf9cAyjYE3_KZD4jQ.text: Came here for Sunday brunch with 2 toddlers in tow. Sat outside on the patio and were well taken care of. Glad to have a new spot in the neighborhood.

lbT8ruOZnGtTyOq9y56uGA.text: Went on the first night of restaurant week. Fiance and I went to this establishment for the first time and overall we were satisfied with the food.  We placed our order and the server asked for everything at once since it was restaurant week.  It took a little longer than expected for our apps to come out but not an abnormally long period of time.    Philly egg rolls were good and so were the lobster corn dogs.  They were still a little warm but on the verge of being cold, but tasty nonetheless.  Within two minutes of our appetizers arriving the entrees showed up...  That was a little frustrating since we had just been brought our appetizers.  Entrees were good!  She had the pasta and thought it was a little spicy for her taste, but that is just personal preference.  I had the pork chops and enjoyed them.  The brussel sprouts were 'swimming' in the sauce that they were served with which I didn't like but they were flavorful. Dessert is were they lost us though.  Fiance ordered the cookie skillet and it was two rock hard cookies in a skillet that she couldn't eat.  I guess we could have asked for clarification prior to ordering but it was not what she was expecting.  I had the lava/molten cake and it was just a solid piece of cake with some ice cream. We think this place has potential and will consider coming back in the future, but not during restaurant week.

ofZ_5hTk8RAr5KLUT4bIdQ.text: Not far from what Kennedy's was. Another solid option for the hood. Service is still an issue. Let's be honest. This place is all about the patio. Which is still there. We shall see what happens when the weather warms up.

aCxgxUFgh8gXWtWWgUODpA.text: I really wanted to like this restaurant. First, the good: -Fun, lively atmosphere with several big TVs make it a good place to watch a game -Good draft beer prices. $4 craft beer of the month, $3.50 Yuengling, $3.25 Miller Lite, etc.  But unfortunately, there was a significant amount of bad: -I asked if the veggie burger patty was homemade and the waitress said yeah so I ordered it but it was clearly a Morningstar frozen patty. When I showed her, she never apologized or said sorry. She just asked if I wanted something else. I ordered the nachos. -The nachos came out without black beans. When I told the waitress, again no apology or sorry. Just a I'll bring you a side bowl of black beans. The side bowl came out only half filled but I poured them over the nachos and began to eat. Overall, pretty tasty but what ruined them were the tortilla chips they use. Absolutely horrible because some of them tasted burnt like maybe they fry the chips themselves but over fried them. Yuck, so I only got through half the nachos before I gave up.  The waitress finally apologized for the veggie burger fiasco when she dropped off the bill, saying that apparently they used to make homemade veggie patties but switched to frozen because their homemade ones weren't sticking together. Still annoyed I was given wrong information prior to ordering because had I not said anything, it's almost as if they're passing off frozen patties as homemade. If they're not even using homemade veggie patties, it makes me wonder how much of their menu is just frozen stuff. I don't want to pay $10-$12 for food I can just warm up at home myself.

9YVbbXOGCS6tJOjVUjHKQA.text: Great bar in walking distance from where I live! This place is a step up from when it was Kennedy's, it definitely feels more open now. The bartenders are great, service is always fast. All of the food I have tried has been spot on as well. Glad to have a good bar in Elizabeth again!

RCEJPQAcMKAnsJW6DsZXnA.text: Great place have been here every weekend since Panthers Season started. Great service, know everyones name, the manager is always checking in. Just confused as to why the Buffalo Chicken Dip is served so cold. #onlyinthesouth

jj_5PDlXALvIA3uykN-ZTQ.text: While our food was cold on delivery, the staff were eating breakfast in front of guest.  Management did come to apologize, but really?

VeKUySiOZZziXwhmMrX4pg.text: I've been to Caswell Station three times. The first two times were before the "official" grand opening. Those times, the service was great and the food was pretty good for the price.   This last time we went, there was a 20 minute wait despite the numerous tables open. I understand that people make reservations so we gladly waited. 20 minutes later our table was ready and we were told we would be seated upstairs. Once we got upstairs it was a completely different atmosphere with four tables, odd lighting, and music playing from a speaker in the corner. It was like we were getting shoved off into some unfinished part of the restaurant where they put people when they were too busy. On top of that we waited for 13 minutes to even have our waitress come greet us, even when the manager went in and out of the upstairs three times. After the 13 minutes we were done waiting and left. Don't expect anything close to the same experience if they hide you away upstairs.

spGZh2F0NOqZjj_c6LWqKA.text: Awesome food! In total we ordered the dip trio, cheesesteak egg rolls, Hawaiian burger, fajita salad and mojito. Everything was delicious, but we would most recommend the dip trio. The pimento cheese and buffalo chicken dip were delicious. We'll definitely be back.

oMx4jaKQTp6XvF_qCyuX8A.text: Places okay water down drinks food is just a tad below average service is okay kind of cold feeling inside but I had to give it a try I'm not a big fan I rather go to Bang Bang Burger across the street

Sd386R761kgSTKcreehIjA.text: Had a layover in Charlotte and found this place by accident-everyone enjoyed the food-highly recommend the Meatloaf!!

zTv-0-hjqibUXaXWuS4flQ.text: One of my favorites in Elizabeth. A unique menu with some really creative and good tasting items. Staff is always friendly and provide excellent service.

fkcYGlEln9xitQZeYi5aYA.text: This restaurant was previously Kennedy's. A regular lunch spot for myself. The building is beautifully redone, parking lot is still a mess. Order a burger with fries to go. Staff was nice and food was quick food was mediocre at best with a heavy price of almost $14.  Fries were thin and soggy. Burger was good needed some seasoning. Overall decent place.

_APvYKEn9YIFoxpZAfWKaA.text: Living in Elizabeth I am so glad to have a restaurant within walking distance that I love. The food was delicious and at a wonderful price point, especially for this area. The Sunday brunch drink specials will definitely keep me coming back each week. All of the staff were friendly and professional. I will definitely recommend Caswell Station to all of my friends!

BOWxBMV3uIOrVAbdZ3-zDA.text: We have lived in the neighborhood for 15 years and was very sad to see Jackelope Jack, P-Stone and Kennedy's all shut down within months of each other.  We have been into Caswell Station for dinner and drinks several times since they have opened and myself and husband couldn't be more pleased.  We have had different bartender and servers each time and had great experiences with all of them.  The food is delicious! (a very nice upgrade from Kennedy's).  They have great food specials each day, (half price burgers one night and half priced flatbreads another).  The flatbreads are STACKED!  Not your typical flatbread that keeps you hungry still etc.  The burgers are also delicious.  They have had live music twice when we were there and it wasn't too loud.  They did a great job remodeling as well.  Keep up the great work, we look forward to your continued success!

FgdJUpLN2qWIPRBOAj6vvw.text: 2 of 2.      Once  The manager received our review.  this is how he replied back privately..  Again wants to bash the consumer and is more worried about the review than the customer experience.    Jason, I'd like to start off by thoroughly apologizing once again for your evening at Caswell. I understand that it was a bad experience and not what you had in mind for a family's night out. However, restaurant experience aside, I take personal issue with a lot of what you rushed home to Concord to put on the internet. Your server absolutely cared, as did I. You mistake not caring with being overwhelmed. If I didn't spend any time trying to make it right then how do I know that you recommend going to Twin Peaks for the games or Union St. to eat a good meal? I said we'd do our best to make your night go up from a poor start...and the way you inhaled your steak there's no doubt in my mind that it did. See guys like yourself ARE the problem with yelp. Cat has your tongue at the table but go home and pound the keyboard. At least you know your strengths. We had a rough go at it tonight but I assure we will learn from it and be better for it. Maybe I can offer you the same opportunity...you see, we operate restaurants to support our families and make a living. Little proof from tonight, but actually are pretty damned good at it too. There's not a yelp for me to come cherry pick and post your worst day at the office online and even if there was I'd probably opt to shake your hand and tell you you'll do better next time B/c shotgun reviews like yours actually affect people livelihood. But hey, all men aren't created equal... that's just how the cookie crumbles, sir. Take care, Jason G.

HC87Qz5baH2ljay2A_YUXw.text: First time going there and i will not be going back. Waitress took forever to get our orders.  Bugs in the drinks and waitress didn't bring us silverware or napkins.  Never again!

FgfS8GuSGShJWcfhcdMxjQ.text: Sat out on the patio on a beautiful Saturday afternoon! The "Hail Mary" bloody Mary was awesome. We had more lunch food than brunch - burgers and flatbreads and everything was great. Our server, Jennifer, was on top of it. I'm happy this is in our neighborhood!

15qLT1I60x9wc9rx5xX6IQ.text: We visited this restaurant on an overnight trip to Charlotte, and it was great. Looking for places online I came across this place and the photo of the place caught my eye. It is an old house that they converted into a restaurant. And it was just as great looking in person as the picture from Yelp. It almost had the feel of hanging out at a friends house. The food was really good and the beer selection was abundant. I got the chipotle and garlic wings and was not disappointed. I think the chipotle wings were the best of the two. My only regret is that we live an hour and a half from us and we can't visit more often.  See ya next visit to Charlotte!

O2fnfWmSCWxXzqzHI6WyhQ.text: We came here as a recommendation from a friend, during restaurant week (Jan 2019). Not sure if the review will be worth it because their restaurant week menu had items that was not on the regular menu. They had a Game of Thrones Game Night going on so we couldn't join. The calamari was good, could've been a little crispier. The cheesesteak egg rolls were BOMB, the red sauce that tasted like sweet and sour sauce was interesting with cheesesteak BUT TRY IT lol. The main dishes, pasta and chicken Marsala, were both VERY tasty! The cookie skillet and cheesecake were BOMB, and I'm not really a sweets person! We did notice that the manager or whoever he was pull the waiter aside (might wanna take these convos out of the dining area, people can see you) like he was was rushing our waiter to get the tables in our area out the way it seemed. So with that we felt rushed, there's nothing wrong with that but we weren't even there that long. Normally for restaurant week your full order is taken but our waiter told us "leave the menu and just let me know what you want next" after the sidebar convo with the manager that's when we felt rushed! Oh well. Besides that everything there was good and they had my favorite beer Juicy Jay so I was happy. If patrons are buying off the main menu, don't rush them.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

3R427GVKjaFCRdIMKACXWg.text: Went to visit Caswell Station, the first new restaurant/bar in the neighborhood since several closed down over the last year or so. I think it was soft opening, so perhaps they can work out some of the issues we encountered on this first visit.   It was Sunday Brunch and when we walked in, we were quickly acknowledged (great!). We were at first directed to sit anywhere, but then another server told us she'd take us to a table. There was some clear confusion between the two. We chose to sit at a booth. Unfortunately once we were seated at a booth, we realized how uncomfortable they are. There was about two inches between us and the table, which couldn't move because of the size of the table base.   We ordered the French toast with bacon and an avocado bacon sandwich with hash browns. The sandwich, which besides the avocado and bacon, had tomato and flavored cream cheese, was very good aside from a little too much cream cheese. The French toast looked nice and was topped with strawberries and whipped cream. Sadly the entire inside was undercooked and fell apart after putting the fork into it.   The service overall was very lackluster. Our server was very hard to find and seemed to have a chip on her shoulder that AM. We had to flag down a different waitress, who was much more obliging, to let them know about the soggy toast.   They removed the item from the bill, and the manager was very nice about it. Our waitress only came back by after the manager stopped over and crassly said something about the toast that indicated she didn't know about our issue, even though she should have since she was our server. She also snapped when I asked for more coffee that she was getting it, even though it took a while to come back by with the pot.   On our way out, we were nicely thanked by two servers sitting at the front, but one was eating a yogurt. Another pet peeve was that the ketchup asked for with the hash browns was served in a plastic to-go container, rather than a bottle or ramekin.   Don't think we'd run back here anytime soon, even though it's within walking distance and they did a nice job remodeling from when it was Kennedy's.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

l6oSYePmR0PCgIYRwD1CYQ.text: We really enjoyed our experience here this evening. My boyfriend and I had a rough day at the hospital, and were greeted with exceptional and attentive service. Ideally, more vegetarian options would be great, but totally understandable for a more laid-back burger-type joint. Very reasonably priced and a delicious meal. The manager was very accommodating and let us hang out for another round after it was slowing down and the bar was about to close. We will definitely be back again!

DF2FUHZOoZjEYZTPUqa_XQ.text: Pretty fond of this place. During a 3-month-long group search for good chicken wings in Clt, we found Caswells and we never left. We eat there about 2 times a week now. Wing Rating on flavor, variety, and not being tough, dry or burnt they win across the board=5 stars.  SOCIAL FRIENDLY RATING 4 STARS. They have Tues bingo and Thurs trivia, lots of TV's, and Karaoke. Kid friendly, Large outside patio with TV's, games, large fans for hot weather and heaters for chilly weather. Lots of seating for large or small groups and a private room upstairs. On-Lot parking is a premium and a little tight but $3 parking is right across the street. We always rate the girls restroom B/C it's important. They had a sauna-type heating issue for a while, which has been fixed, as well as the doors on both stalls not closing, which have also been fixed. Quick, hot water and soap for clean hands and decent TP. Clean and well-staffed = 5 stars. The only reason I put 4 and not 5 stars under Social Friendly is because of the STOOLS. Instruments of torture. SO uncomfortable. Many a night my friends and I left and went to another establishment or just cut our night short B/C our asses hurt. Perhaps the square stools with the round-corners made of red, white or silver metal were a deal but they do not fit everyone. Just a handful of one other variety of seat with--IDK, a little more space in the seat or a different shape or SOMETHING, would keep us there longer for sure. Good marketing to keep people there longer with something as simple as a comfortable stool.  FOOD & BEV RATING 5 STARS. There are only a few things I have not tried here but IMO this is above average bar food. It seems to have gotten even better in the past 2 months. There are some pretty creative selections on the menu and something for everyone. Great food specials including nights when kids eat FREE. The salads are always fresh, wonderful avocados and they even have a pretty good Brussel Sprout appetizer, although not really "crispy". All the burgers and main plates I've had (almost all of 'em) are well above average. You must try the Flat Breads. They are Excellent. Working my way through the Main Plates. Love the MeatLoaf, Pork Chops and Elizabeth Pasta. Prices are very reasonable for what you get and they have a great selection of alcoholic bevs. and some unreal specials. Kids menu is pretty good. They have food specials almost every day of the week and they even get points for presentation. The only thing I've had that was not good IMO were the CheeseSteak egg rolls. Not much cheesesteak flavor and not much egg roll flavor or crunch.   SERVICE AND STAFF RATING 5 STARS. Every single person who has waited on us in the past 6 months has been very friendly, personable and attentive. They really listen and pay attention to anticipate your needs so you're not desperately trying to flag down your server for more coke, etc. They are very patient when we get rowdy and I have seen particular attention and patience given to pets and special needs kids. Clean utensils, plates, tables and chairs. Occasionally the menus need to be wiped off and I have a pet peeve about not getting a cocktail napkin with a drink to wipe my fingers after squeezing the lemon or lime. I hate using my big dinner napkin for that.  Really like this place despite the uncomfortable stools. Looking forward to trying the Surf & Turf Fajitas, the Fried Crispy Pickles and the Caswell & Veggie Burgers.

ah68k6qDxGqkRhsbmxyg9Q.text: I went to Caswell Station last night on a reconnaissance mission. Ever since Kennedy's closed, the neighbors have been anticipating a new "walk-to" place. I wanted to check it out. I only stopped in for a glass of wine late so I could look at the menu and see what it was like inside. Basically it still a sports bar type place. The difference is in the menu (some interesting appetizers, flat breads, sandwiches and main dishes) plus the red blend I ordered was good for the price. I will go back ASAP to have dinner and will update my review then.  Big positive: they give 10% off food to hospital employees. Yay! somewhere else to walk to.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

nhAqnJhmr4_U1pT8bcKZ3A.text: The waiter was so kind as well as the entire staff that brought out the food. The food was delicious and they accommodate all of our annoying exchanges (my mom literally asked for so many substitutions lol). The chicken melt is with pita bread which wasn't my favorite but it was my fault for not reading closer. We will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

rZ-2ZCNZrkjA2rScbk3TVQ.text: thanks caswell, for helping me recover from my last yelp review (I needed a drink). Breakfast burger was excellent, friendly staff. I'm about it,will be back.

V3hCfuZE0_HCP2Y4fh76Yw.text: Love coming here!! The food is delicious (I recommend the Cheesesteak Egg Rolls, Tatchos and the Neighborhood Grilled Cheese) and the staff is very friendly and quick! We will continue to come back over and over again.

pDpB3evKZ0aBMYe60yhvuw.text: Better food than you'd expect in a place like this.  Nachos, burgers and sandwiches are especially good and their daily soup is even homemade.  Friendly servers, fair prices for the quality.    Sometimes it can be noisy and I wish they had a bit deeper draft list, but these are small complaints.  Great neighborhood spot.

sK3T19aiiiTksGsZP_hynA.text: I stopped by here the other day with a medium size group of friends, the service provided by our waitress Elizabeth was outstanding! I had the breakfast burger and it was on point, the meat was juicy enough for a good flavor. I definitely coming back soon on a Sunday and watch the games!!!

ah5nSjCeqJtMKYtBjwRoaA.text: First night of restaurant week and no better place to try out than Caswell Station in Elizabeth.  Great neighborhood feel and atmosphere, friendly and personable staff and management, drinks always go down smoothe, and can't say enough about the food.  Try and find something you don't like there.  If you do, I'll buy your meal...    The people that visit the first time come back, unless they were like this d-bag tonight who sat behing us and acted like a whiny b!#*h, knowing the place was packed, kitchen was swamped, and the servers and bar was catering to please as usual, yet he complains that the food took longer than his expectation. Management makes it right either way and comps the entire table of 3.    Dude was a joke and if I only knew his name, I would share so someone he knows can tell him he would be a better fit on Montford.   Bye Felicia...  Let Caswell's continue to build their clientele and be prosperous.

XvgZ44iCiQubGDLXEpblzw.text: Great place to go with friends if you want something laid back and chill. I got the Meatloaf that came with mashed potatoes and green beans (I'm crazy for country food). I asked for no green beans to sub it for a cup of soup. (Also CRAZY for soup whether it's winter or summer). To drink I got the Slice of Cucumber. Instead of Gin, I asked for Tito's with it. The drink was definitely one of my favorite drinks... refreshing, cold, and delicious! We also got a round of lemon drop shots. Would come again!

M1-BJXbQU_nahXjDjG1XVA.text: I hate leaving this review, as I mostly loved Kennedy's (the previous establishment in this location) in its hey-day--heck, I rented it out for my 30th birthday party. I've been here 12-15 times since it became Caswell Station, but it's already exhibiting the same issues that plagued Kennedy's in its final moments--a complete lack of interest in customer experience.   I am literally sitting here, right now. We made reservations online earlier today in advance of the Panthers game--then called to confirm. They were confirmed. Upon arrival, we were told that they weren't supposed to have reservations for Panthers games, and had lost any record of it. "Luckily," we were able to squeeze five grown men around a (small) 4-person table.   Then we get to service--I don't know of it is our particular server, or whether it's management issues, but wow. She comes by every 30-40 minutes, at best. We are drinking cheap beers on a guys' night, that's not sufficient. We raised the issue with the hostess and the waitress, yet it continues. We just now started ordering from the bar.   And then, of course, they see the need to pay for an awful DJ to blare crappy music during commercials. Here's an idea, get rid of that guy, and pay someone extra to serve food and beer.   Just a terrible, terrible experience. It could be so much better, if they even pretended to care.  [Edit:  my previous 2-Star review was a bit harsh. As mentioned, I've been here more than a dozen times. Most of those times involve sitting at the bar--the bartenders are very good. So I'm bumping it to a 3, based on that. At the same time, the above review is completely True).

C5prMoyENlH8Kh9P0-gsZQ.text: Good menu with a wide variety of options.    I selected the soup of the day, which was a chicken tortilla soup.   It was delicious and I smacked my lips!  I also had a BUILD MY OWN salad.  It was a generous portion and the strawberry dressing was very yummy.   My lunch companion had the BLT on sour dough with a small bucket of fries.   It was all very tasty.  Unfortunately, there were a few things that were out of whack.  My companion wanted a glass of one of the wines on the menu.  That wine was not available.   Secondly, their towel dispenser in the restroom was broken and they just had a roll of towels that their patrons had to tear off on their own.   Finally, the noise level was annoying to us as we were trying to have a good discussion.   They have only been open for a few weeks and I am sure they will get better and better.   Based on the quality of the food, I would return.  I just need to take someone whose words I don't need to hear and I can already think of a few people . . .

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

6J_QaCeu3vJJ5Rg_9ZDt7Q.text: I visited Caswell Station for the first time last night. I had dinner at the bar with a friend and the bartender Drake was very friendly and familiar with the items on the menu to provide great recommendations. I had the $6.00 Caswell burger which is their Wednesday night special and a bottle of wine which is half price on Wednesday. The burger was very good and full of flavor. I had to leave before the live band started to play, but I will definitely be back.

tJqficFqFqUG5QMMaw73Lw.text: Dry, overly sauced wings. Spinach dip tasted like broccoli cheddar soup. Cold buffalo chicken dip.

tdHwByeP-TpBGd5O-ueTCw.text: Get the Neighborhood grilled cheese sandwich!!! It's absolutely delicious and worth every single pound you'll gain from it. We stumbled upon this restaurant and have been coming back just for the sandwich alone.

h4gud9s5oxKSBnpK3XJb5w.text: Great little joint, good drinks, good people, good food....TRIFECTA

miji2QbP8ULpx3q9k4sfxQ.text: Great service and great food!!! My husband and I went there on a Sunday night for some beers and appetizers. We had the lemon pepper chicken wings and the spinach dip, which came inside a beautiful bread-bowl. Both were delicious. Our waitress went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed and even the manager checked in on us. I definitely recommend this place!

0rKd8Qbc8EdaoY-gjQfwgQ.text: Went here for burger week. My partner got the Pimento burger, I got the Hawaiian. Both were great except we each asked for ours to be cooked medium and medium-rare, to which we were both given well done burgers. Service was very slow, she didn't tell us her name. Annoying band playing that has something they think is intriguing called "table interrogation". Cool atmosphere, food and service could both be better. Dog friendly, which is nice. might consider coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patio area

5DvPFYlhImMYUfYBaWyM3g.text: I just left this establishment.  Not to mention the poor service, there was a cigar   thrown over the patio, then , there was a Moscow  mule thrown which hit my under a year old jeeps hood. We approached the "general manager" which seemed to think it wasn't a big deal. I would NEVER visit this restaurant . Obviously they dont care about their customers nor how they handle situations.

1tA_6QymIq8XCnP3ubxDCg.text: Love this spot so much. Great prices drinks and food. Only knock is I wish they could get their draft beer about ten degrees colder and open the outdoor bar once in a blue moon

C4Dw_PBtJT-lQWzZ2PTp7w.text: We held a baby shower here today and they were amazing!!! Heidi was our server and she never stopped amazing us!!! We had a pretty large group and refills were aflowing!!! Great job y'all!!!

NG1InRch7gWtvtU_LCQgcg.text: I have been here a couple times and it is always great! The first time I went they had a burger special. They have great burgers and they are big! I also got wings that were good. They have drink specials often and usually have events from time to time. I went for their anniversary event this past weekend and it was great! They had great drink specials and a DJ. The staff is super friendly. They have a nice outdoor space with tables and tv outside for when there is nice weather. I plan on going back from time to time.

mpfnK3Nq_Qys2bqeyWyrKA.text: I came in on Monday night with my husband and there was a huge college football game coming on. We were greeted by the hostess and seated promptly, being given the option to sit wherever we preferred. Our waiter greeted us shortly after being seated and, with this being our first time there, he was very helpful. We shared the Philly cheesesteak egg rolls, I ordered the shrimp and avocado salad, and my husband ordered the veggie burger. When I tell you everything we ate was EXCELLENT!!! Whew chile! The food was cooked and seasoned perfectly! My husband inhaled his food without saying much of anything and I did the same because it was so tasty! Following our meal, we both mentioned that we would absolutely come back in the near future! The staff was friendly, the prices were reasonable and the food tasted excellent! I would definitely recommend trying it. With the numerous big screen TVs and casual atmosphere, it's perfect for catching a game or just a casual evening. I will mention that the tables are bar height which could make it difficult for smaller kids to eat comfortably but they do have a few booths, if they're not already taken, that you can choose from.

bQ-DO3ajx1EASkEe2vNgPA.text: Great experience. We went there on a crowded Thursday for their trivia night and got excellent service despite it being packed. They have great specials and the food is very good for bar food. Great management! Glad to call this our neighborhood bar.

JQLV910syjVDf8sXcFhzcg.text: Great Day in the Morning! An absolute gem of a Lunch spot! Good atmosphere, the service was top notch, very attentive. The tot's were amazing! The wings were bar non 1 of the best around, the burger was great too! I also heard that the Mac& cheese was surprisingly award winning! Must try that next time! This ones a Keeper!

RCWlCKDXZMMYGX64wZHgIA.text: I got the house grilled cheese and it was amazing. Their Moscow Mule has a small twist with orange flavored vodka but it did not disappoint. There also was a small band playing music, I stayed for hours just listening to them after my meal and enjoying the patio. Great place, great staff!

nH2gOsLQ9RcEpHWqVd8O1A.text: Seems like a great place to come on a Sunday afternoon to watch sports but I don't think I would return for dinner. It concerned me when I walked in on a Saturday night and they didn't seem very busy and the parking lot was basically empty. We were there at 7:30 so I gave it the benefit of the doubt that we were just eating later. After having dinner there, I understand why it wasn't busy. I had the French onion soup and the bread felt and tasted like a BRICK. It wasn't soft and soggy at all like it's supposed to be. I also ordered a shrimp taco which was decent but I've had better. My boyfriend had the buffalo chicken flatbread which he said the hot sauce was REALLY HOT. Our food all came out at weird times but it was REALLY QUICK! Like oddly quick how soon our food came out.

zcgmHrdGC6HI7qmZpt_ubA.text: The staff is always friendly and helpful! Go for a gathering with your friends outside on the nice patio. Inside has a few booths, but otherwise, for some reason they choose uncomfortable, tall metal barstools for the entire place. The food is mediocre to the point of me asking myself "are they even trying to prepare a decent meal for their customers?"  Their "seafood" soup had canned chicken thrown in! As a pescatarian, I was not happy!

S7adv5XQd6MMF7AoGIUNbw.text: We came for restaurant week and will definitely be going back. The ambiance was really nice can't wait for the summer to sit out on the patio area. The food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak egg rolls
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Chicken pasta
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ice cream sundae

mrP4K642Mk6w8Cn5NuivNQ.text: I'm always looking for a good spot that's open fairly late. Went to Caswell Station on a Wednesday night because I actually had a coupon. First the actual building is kind of cute since it's a big old house. We walked in to a large clean bar and restaurant with some fun style and tons of tvs. Great spot to watch a game I'd imagine, will have to come back for that. Our server was super friendly, attentive, and lovely. We ordered the cheesesteak egg rolls and Brussels to start. Love the egg rolls, cheese and beef deep fried with a tangy dipping sauce, what's not to love. The Brussels were a super large portion and very tasty but the texture wasn't my favorite, that's just personal preference. I ordered the neighborhood grilled cheese, so good, totally worth the clogged arteries. My bf had the burger which he said was good but not great. I'll definitely go back for some better than your basic bar food.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussels
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Neighborhood grilled cheese yum!
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak egg rolls

XfVz914WpSr6za2VyrLHZg.text: Pros: Cool venue Great for a sporting event Extensive menu Good location  Cons: HORRIBLE parking It's a little loud, especially when games are on. The food was disappointing. It left a lot to be desired.  The cookie skillet was terrible. Had one bite and left the rest.   Would I go back? Maybe for a game or drinks and an app. I probably wouldn't get dinner there again.

p96sU2U23fPAVOqeGTUynA.text: Absolutly horrible. This was my second time coming here and I will never come back. First, the waiter refused to substitute an item (even when I offered to pay a surcharge on the new item) because of my dietary restrictions. Only after talking to another person, was I able to get the item substituted.   Second, the waiter was inattentive and, after numerous requests, members of my party had to go into the bar to get refills, waters, etc. Two members of my party were overlooked for ordering food and then when they said, a few minutes later, that they needed to order, the waiter was short and said something about how it was their fault they didn't order.   Third, food was late for multiple members of our party - one person actually had to ask where his food was after everyone else had received their food half an hour earlier.   Having worked in the service industry myself, I'm willing to overlook a lot. I am not willing to overlook complete ineptness in service by our server - Anthony. I will never return.

YV8j1M3ht_SRHj-9eehnTA.text: The only reason this isn't a 1 Star review is because of the location. This is such a cool space and location with so much potential! But...  The food is horrendous. Everything tasted like it came out of the freezer directly into the fryer. Just garbage.   Caswell, if you want to survive, please invest in a chef and improving the quality of your food  Pictured:  A two bite taco that costs like $5. Hands and beer for scale  Liquidy "pimento cheese dip"   Not pictured: Disgusting chicken fingers, brussel sprouts, burger

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Liquidy pimento cheese
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tiny overpriced taco

W8oWGhL_X2CLBIG-i5B0Tw.text: Great burgers and atmosphere.  The jambalaya soup was awesome too.  Very cool place to hang out with friends, grab a burger, beer or whatever.  Friendly staff in a cool part of town.  Parking in back was easy, but may get tight if things are busy.  I'll be back to watch a game and love the $6 burger + $1 side Wednesday special.

HfYXQrhJeThiRQd_7e0HIg.text: Excited for this place to be reopening in the neighborhood.  I've been a couple of times and they've been really slow.  I'm hoping this will change as people catch word of the new spot.  Food is okay and just what you would expect from a bar.  Not a place that I would say is great for date night but awesome to watch a game.  I had the 7th street salad and it was delicious! A little small for the price so you might want to snack on an appetizer.  While I'm at it.... pick your cheat day and DO order their cheese steak egg rolls!  The Caswell burger is great too.  It's a big sandwich so you might want to share with a friend.  Lastly, I've also had the quesadilla. Nothing to write home about.  What I expected.  It's the same layout as Kennedy's but with fresh paint.  Looks like they've added a little outdoor area to play games such as corn hole.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. 7th street salad is my favorite menu item so far!  Small for the price so be sure to order some appetizers.
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

zGfZJeQV1H15uUgyRyR9zw.text: PROS Food is delicious. Trust me. Delicious. And prices are excellent value for money. We have been several times since it has been Caswell Station (formerly Kennedys, RIP). Seriously, great food every time and it doesn't disappoint.  CONS What is going on with the a/c unit? I have been this summer and it has been hot as balls inside. Like literally sweating as I am sitting there. I know it is an old building, but get it together mgt. I went another time and sat at the booths along where the window is and the a/c was blowing straight down on me. It was so cold I had to move onto his side of the booth. This is the booth that is by the window, but closest to the bathroom.   The high top table chairs- these are so uncomfortable. The metal digs into my bum, and my bum is average size! Only tiny bums in these seats!

NxIGoo2Bi2tw7dkzaaDEug.text: Food was bar food.  We went for the NC State/Duke game, reserved a table, and still got put up in the attic with one other table of State fans - very disappointing!  We could've done the same thing at home.

tnilt-GstG0z6ZGRJNeevA.text: First time here. Came in for their CLT Burger Week burger and was so pleasantly surprised. First off, the actual place is pretty neat, especially all lit up at night.  Second, besides walking in on music bingo (was too late to actually win anything, but still fun to play!), it was also $3 draft night and ALL their burgers were $6 for burger week, not just the featured Hawaiian & Pimento burgers.  Third, the staff are so friendly! My bartender was the best! She not only made amazing recs in getting my burger medium & the tots over the fries, but was on point w/her beer suggestions!  Will definitely be back, probably on a Tues night again!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Haven&#39;t seen one of these in awhile
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Hawaiian Burger + tots
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

JgRD8LAv14fGbINwsUDW3A.text: I live in the neighborhood and this is my go to spot. Drinks are good and the food is soild  And... pork chops are great! And AJ is AJ.

02XT0YiiF2rWVVqNIIpKiQ.text: Second time here for brunch and I must say this was better than the last.   First off, they have $12 mimosa carafes. Winning! Because what's brunch without mimosas?!   Next, I didn't order from the brunch menu as I had a taste for lunch food rather than breakfast like things. I had the ribeye plate. OMG. It's been a long time since I've cleaned a plate! The plate comes with a 12oz ribeye with blue cheese butter, a lobster twice baked potato and spinach (I subbed the spinach for the roasted brussel sprouts with bacon). They cooked my steak perfectly, the potato was creamy and had a great amount of lobster pieces and the brussels were crispy and savory.   Let's just say I'll def be back again and again for this plate...oh and the mimosas!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribeye plate- blue cheese butter, lobster twice baked potato and brussel sprouts with bacon.

nqljjN9eEpyGUGzLDs4_Ww.text: Love this place! Went here most recently for burger week in Charlotte and got the Pimento Burger and it was very good! Also REALLY love their cheesesteak eggs rolls! Always have great, quick service here and the staff is very nice. Plenty of seating inside and they have a great outside patio. Perfect to watch a sporting event!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento burger
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak eggrolls with honey siracha sauce
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mule

jFtiiJD0Ud4MHX56SQKwuA.text: The food and drinks were good but the service by the blonde Haley was on point!!! Thank you for a great experience!

Rm7Rucr7e9MopVQVNV6Gqg.text: Special are awesome food tast great. Came for Thursday Trivia which starts at 7 BigPopTrivia is great and through your phone. The host was awesome and very engaging. Came early for food we had a large group. Susan suggested we move downstairs and she'd pushed tables together for our group so we could eat and participate in trivia.  Really liked thw Totchos the beef was so tender and well seasoned. Definitely got 4 shrimp tacos.  1/2 off cocktails had the  Honey Smash spicy and sweet  $2 tacos 1/2 appetizers  $1 sides $3 select beers

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. upstairs room
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. fried pickles
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. upstairs bathroom

9DQXic13fjmf5pv0yYciug.text: The Lady and I had a totally decent experience here, but we recognize it was also Monday night at 8pm when we arrived. Service was still a tad on the slow side, so it does worry me that the rest of the reviews are totally correct when it comes to the staff being the biggest problem of Caswell.  There *is* parking behind Caswell station, and that's a good thing too because there's no other parking elsewhere in the area. I think I might've seen a sign about overflow parking as well, but I didn't get a good idea where that was located.  The actually building itself kind of reminds me of Angry Ales in Montford, but more house-like. It's dim with TONS of TVs, but it was a nice night out so The Lady and I sat outside (again, plenty of TVs to watch games!) on the main patio. There's also a lower patio with astroturf where you can sit.   We both ordered cocktails - I got the Caswell Mule (sweet but a good flavor) and The Lady ordered some type of spritz that she liked a lot. At that point, we hadn't read any reviews, so we ordered an appetizer of the Crispy Asian Brussel Sprouts, because that sounds good, right? Nah. It's not crispy at all, and the sauce is weird and can get a little mushy. So, skip on that. For our entree, I saw that they had a Monday night special of $.75/wing so I went in on 12 wings, half with the Chipotle sauce and half with a honey hot. They came out fresh and the sauces were good, with blue cheese, carrots, and celery (just like every good wing plate should have). Props to them on doing wings better than average here!  I think I would come back to Caswell with a group without question because I didn't have a bad experience, but there wasn't anything standout that makes me really want to rave about them or come back. I won't really remember this place in T-1 week.

zM06_kV4p72EK9BjHpLmVQ.text: The Cajun pasta is phenomenal. I also highly recommend going on their half price flatbread days.

u-58HfQIIWBmBhQ7omZ89w.text: I love this place. On my visit I had the cheesesteak egg rolls, the pork chop & Brussel sprouts. Everything was soooooo good! This place is definitely somewhere I would recommend trying.

mxGJKqYn9Ur9zw3DasLPnw.text: Interesting little place to try out. It's a two story house/ restaurant with an outdoor area for seating also. We came on a Saturday evening, the weekend before Halloween. They had a Halloween costume contest, and I will say the guy on stilts (assuming he's an employee) was pretty awesome!   We were seated right away, the only seating available was outside, and my only complaint was there was not enough heating lamps on the deck (2) so it was a bit chilly. But on the plus side we were surrounded by football games on every screen and we were not inside where it was very loud. Oh and the lighting ambiance was pretty nice also.  The food was AWESOME! We ordered their nachos for an appetizer, and those were smothered in queso and other yummy nacho goodness.  I ordered the Hawaiian burger, which was full of spice and flavor. It had grilled pineapple, jalapeno smoked bacon, and a mango jalapeno sauce. That was probably one of the best burgers I have had in a while. Different and good!   Overall I would come back and give this place another try next time I am in town. This seems like a place locals love and enjoy. Which is a plus to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Halloween night costume contest
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Man on stilts (Halloween costume contest)
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hawaiian Burger

J9nqGkBsFDjeP3cFcAc0mg.text: I only came here for drinks, so this review reflects drinks and service only. It was a Sunday night, they have indoor and outdoor seating. It's a pretty big place overall. Of course they have the usual Sunday mimosa special for $2 and a double for $4. It was delicious, I hope one could never mess up a mimosa.   They have outdoor TVs for football and sports, which is nice. The waitress was friendly. She was personable and carried a nice conversation. Recommended for Sunday Funday fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

yYqDoj83o7hSfH7ZPLQ31w.text: My first time here since it is no longer Kennedys and it was average. Nothing super awesome, but also not bad. Got to love a place that has tater tots and tatchos.   I had the Mexican burger and it was good, and the tater tots were warm and crispy.   My friend got the chicken and avocado wrap and said it was too much avocado, but I am not sure how that's possible. Ha.   Another friend got the dip trip and commented the pimento cheese was a bit runny, but honestly I was inhaling my food and didn't notice hers. Ha!  On another note, the women's restroom is special. One stall the door doesn't close and the handle to the door out is like turned the wrong way.   Tight parking entrance, so pray that no one is exiting when you are entering or vice versa.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mexican burger and tots

NgUwjnKWSrk4S3RvogjEfA.text: I have been here a couple times - once for dinner and another for their first anniversary celebration.The staff was great during both visits! The first time I was here my fiance and I sat outside and ordered burgers and wings to split. They were having a special. Both were pretty good and reasonably priced. It was a nice day out and there were a lot of people outside on the patio. It looked like a nice place to come and have a drink and relax. I'll have to come back for that.   The second time I was here was for their anniversary celebration. There were great drink specials and a DJ. The DJ seemed a little out of place - like they were trying too hard to have people dance when most people were just hanging around the bar or outside.

-HNDunFofmETN4zBeZOCzA.text: Came here for a brunch where I wouldn't have to wait hours and it did not disappoint! The restaurant itself is very cute with lots of outdoor seating. The food was delicious. I just wish they had a Bloody Mary/mimosa special on Saturdays.

FBY7XOCFTISw8xrw31ijAQ.text: My husband and I resolved that this is a good place to go to drink, but NOT a good place for food.  We went there for a late lunch one Sunday. The place was not busy so we were seated right away at a nice breezy table and the waitress immediately brought a water bowl out for our pooch, which was very nice. The service throughout our visit was very accommodating (which is the only reason this is a 3-star review not a 2-star one). However, we were incredibly unimpressed by the food.  We specifically asked about the Crispy Asian Glazed Brussels Sprouts appetizer, and the waitress raved about them. So we ordered them, but wish we had sent them back as soon as they got to the table. They were NOT crispy. In fact they were mushy and gross. I've had better brussels sprouts out of my own freezer. They were also overly sauced. Definitely not worth the $8 price tag.  We also each ordered the Strawberry Salad and both added Shrimp as a protein. The salad was fine, nothing to rave about, but was a bit small for an entree salad. $16 for a salad with shrimp is within the range I'd expect to pay, but it simply wasn't very delicious.   After tax and tip, both my husband and I agreed that this meal was not even close to being worth the $50+ we spent, and we had no interest in eating there ever again.   I can see how the place would be nice for drinking and watching a game on the many TVs, but it's just not up to snuff when it comes to the quality of their food. (I blame an overly active microwave that they're definitely using instead of an oven or grill for items like the brussels sprouts and the shrimp that went on our salads).

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach and strawberry salad, added grilled shrimp
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussel sprout appetizer. Really squishy and disappointing.

fcYWNq5_hGxNCBqyW3srGw.text: Drop what you are doing, go here and order the cheesesteak egg rolls. These might be the best item on the menu, in my humble opinion, but honestly, they are fantastic!   Caswell has taken over the spot that Kennedy's used to occupy, and they have cleaned up the inside, and definitely improved the menu. Overall, I like the vibe here now more, it just seems cleaner/better overall. There's games and activities on their large porch area, but there's also ample amount of seating outside, perfect for our Charlotte weather! The inside has ample seating, but still struggles with the same problem Kennedy's had...the AC! They do have additional units inside, but it still struggles because the building itself is older (but don't let that deter you).   The Caesar salad isn't anything to write home about, in terms of their food, but that was really the only miss out of everything we have ordered there. My husband loves their wings, both because of their meatiness and their spice/flavor options. We have also come for brunch, and their avocado toast is fantastic for a summer day.   Definitely check this place out, you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings. Half hot half lemon pepper
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. The amazing cheesesteak egg rolls
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caesar salad

8GX7MGiT67XI2UxaorQ0YA.text: What a great place and a great time. My food (crispy Asian glazed Brussels sprouts and what they call Elizabeth pasta which is penne pasta with grilled chicken and roasted squash, broccoli, green beans, tomatoes, sliced jalapenos and zucchini in a Cajun cream sauce) was tremendous. The music choices were also great as they were head bobbing and smooth. Then big surprise, a gorgeous guitarist came on at 7pm and entertained the patio crowd until 10. Great song list. What a night to watch the sunset over the Charlotte skyline. Highly recommend and will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Asian Brussels sprouts
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Elizabeth pasta
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entryway. Also the playlist is fantastic.

f8L5FNijXESMDzlv83P61A.text: Thriving. Tasty. Accommodating. Economical.  We went to Caswell for Mother's Day brunch. Started the day with yoga on the lawn, enjoyed our free mimosa and then dove into the brunch menu. The patio has ample shade and our service was excellent. They kept our water filled, the drinks coming and our food was delicious.   At noon on Sunday they have a DJ on the patio, what more could you ask for? A real Sunday-funday!  They have live music on Wednesday, Friday and Saturday nights too!  Highly suggest popping into Caswell. They have a lot to offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

DEdi-xOgfEvA3izJSQtmZQ.text: I definitely enjoyed going here. Our waitress was very attentive and fast. There was also an event going on with great specials on mimosas and beers. The mashed potatoes were the highlight. Also pictured is the veggie burger which was very standard. Nothing really stood out. I'd definitely get it again just ask for my bun to not be toasted. It look from it bc it felt like I was eating my burger on toast. In the other picture is the wings and tots my friend had. His wings looked very well seasoned and just the right amount of sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Caswell Station - Charlotte, NC, United States

J2geD_xX9dx3_zX2fAO2XQ.text: Been to Caswell's a few times, the food is great. But the service is normally terrible. For instance, our server proceeded to take our orders. We asked for appetizers to come out first and my friend asked for her side salad to come out first. The food runner brought out our main dishes out first. We told him that we had ordered appetizers and were expecting them to come out first. Didn't get them until after all of our main course dishes were out. And my friend she didn't get her side salad until after she got her main dish. To top it off the server never even checked on us until it was time for the check. And she messed that up! My friend who ordered the side salad got charged for one of my other friends food.  To sum it up, the food is great, service is terrible.
